snippet: A revival opening on Sunday gives a nod to today’s refugees, an addition by the director Bartlett Sher that raised objections from the lyricist, Sheldon Harnick.
abstract: Revival of Fiddler on the Roof at Broadway Theater has added special opening and closing scenes highlighting global refugee crisis; director Bartlett Sher fought for short additions, finally winning over musical’s original lyricist Sheldon Harnick after preview audiences respond positively to changes; editing fuels ongoing debate about amending beloved, well-known theater works.
lead_paragraph: A revival opening on Sunday gives a nod to today’s refugees, an addition by the director Bartlett Sher that raised objections from the lyricist, Sheldon Harnick.
